introduction: Your neighbors have a child with Down syndrome. They told you it is also called trisomy 21, which is caused by a genetic error called nondisjunction. You have not heard about this problem before and are looking up the definition and the causes of this problem.
question: What is nondisjunction and what causes it?

answers.text: Nondisjunction is the errors in splitting genetic materials when our body cells divide.

ref.title: The origin of human aneuploidy
ref.text: Review in Hum Mol Genet. 2007 Oct 15; School of Molecular Biosciences, Washington State University, Pullman, WA 99164, USA. terryhassold@wsu.edu

answers.text: A type of cell division that takes only one of two copies of each chromosome (cell structures that store genetic information) from the parent cell, for the baby to have a set of chromosomes from each parent, is called meiosis.
When the cells divide for growth and to maintain our bodies, the number of chromosomes remains the same in the new cells, and this type of cell division is called mitosis.
Non-disjunction can happen during both types of cell division.

ref.title: Origin and mechanisms of non-disjunction in human autosomal trisomies
ref.text: Review Hum Reprod. 1998 Feb; Mitera Maternity Hospital, Athens, Greece.

ref.title: Sequence of centromere separation another mechanism for the origin of nondisjunction

answers.text: When the chromosomes fail to split properly, it causes a condition called aneuploidy (having too many or too few chromosomes instead of the normal two of each).

ref.title: To err (meiotically) is human: the genesis of human aneuploidy
ref.text: Review Nat Rev Genet. 2001 Apr; Department of Genetics, Case Western Reserve University, 10,900 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, Ohio 44106, USA. tjh6@pop.cwru.edu

ref.title: Selfish centromeres and the wastefulness of human reproduction
ref.text: LoS Biol. 2022 Jul 5; Wissenshaftskolleg zu Berlin, Berlin, Germany.

answers.text: Nondisjunction can be caused by the genes and environment.

ref.title: Etiology of nondisjunction in humans
ref.text: Review in Environ Mol Mutagen. 1995; Department of Genetics, Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine, Cleveland, Ohio 44106-4955, USA.

answers.text: During meiosis, both women's eggs and male sperm may have faulty chromosomes.
It happens more often in older women and in men who inherited faulty chromosomes.

ref.title: Origin and mechanisms of non-disjunction in human autosomal trisomies
ref.text: Review in Hum Reprod. 1998 Feb; Mitera Maternity Hospital, Athens, Greece.

ref.title: Chromosome Segregation in the Oocyte: What Goes Wrong during Aging
ref.text: Review Int J Mol Sci. 2022 Mar 7; Center of Gynecology, Endocrinology and Reproductive Medicine-Artemida, Jagiellonska Street 78, 10-357 Olsztyn, Poland.

answers.text: Hormone imbalance plays an important role in nondisjunction.

ref.title: Mechanisms of nondisjunction: facts and perspectives

answers.text: Faulty chromosomes in sperm were linked to drug treatments, occupational agents and lifestyle.

ref.title: Gender effects on the incidence of aneuploidy in mammalian germ cells
ref.text: Review in Environ Res. 2007 May; Section of Toxicology and Biomedical Sciences, ENEA CR Casaccia, Rome, Italy.
